title: No, the country hip-hop star Nass X didn't fall out of Rangler after he came out gay.
text: You may have heard of the country's hip-hop hip-hop player, Night Nass X, who recently gained international fame after calling it "The Old City Road" in late 2018. Unfortunately, with the stars come rumors. The night of Nass X, whose real name is Montero Lamar Hill, appeared as gay in a Twitter article on June 30, the last day of Pride. The day after that, LFR Solutions published a story claiming that Hill had been dropped from his endorsement of Rangler because of detection. The article, which has reached more than 16,700 shares on Facebook since its publication on 1 July, has been referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misinformation in its broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) The whole story was made up. The stories may have been MIMIC articles found in the heads, but they must be confirmed to be extremely sound." It is clear that many readers did not see this text, misinterpreted it as true news, and often shared the story so much that Rangler eventually responded to the rumors on Twitter that the partnership with Lil Nas X is still "in full effect." "We're aware of a fake news article that publishes misleading information about our cooperation with Lil Nas X and takes issues like this seriously," rewrites Rangler on July 10.
